Every member receives one personal token. Also, two additional tokens are awarded to each member for every friend they have on the network. Also, each two friends may agree to each return one or two tokens they have obtained on behalf of their friendship.InputFirst line of input contains two integer numbers $$$n$$$ and $$$k$$$ ($$$2$$$ $$$\\leq$$$ $$$n$$$ $$$\\leq$$$ $$$12500$$$, $$$1$$$ $$$\\leq$$$ $$$k$$$ $$$\\leq$$$ $$$1000000$$$) - number of members in network and number of friendships.Next $$$k$$$ lines contain two integer numbers $$$a_i$$$ and $$$b_i$$$ ($$$1$$$ $$$\\leq$$$ $$$a_i$$$, $$$b_i$$$ $$$\\leq$$$ $$$n$$$, $$$a_i$$$ $$$\\neq$$$ $$$b_i$$$) - meaning members $$$a_i$$$ and $$$b_i$$$ are friends.OutputFirst line of output should specify the number of members who are keeping their personal token.The second line should contain space separated list of members who are keeping their personal token.Each of the following $$$k$$$ lines should contain three space separated numbers, representing friend pairs and number of tokens each of them gets on behalf of their friendship.ExamplesInput2 1 1 2Output1 1  1 2 0Input3 3 1 2 1 3 2 3Output0 1 2 0 2 3 1 1 3 2NoteIn the first test case, only the first member will keep its personal token and no tokens will be awarded for friendship between the first and the second member.In the second test case, none of the members will keep their personal token. There are $n$ people in a network, and $k$ friendships between them. Each person starts with 1 token. For each friendship, 2 tokens are given to each person in the friendship. However, each person can choose to return 0, 1, or 2 of their tokens.  

The goal is to find:

1. The number of people who keep at least one of their original tokens.
2. A list of those people.
3. For each friendship, the number of tokens each person in the friendship keeps.



Let me know if you'd like help with the algorithm to solve this!

You are given a number of people and a list of friendships between them. Each person starts with one token. For each friendship, two additional tokens are given to each person in the friendship.  People can choose to return one token.  Friends can also agree to each return one or two tokens they received because of their friendship.  

Find the number of people who keep their original token and list them. For each friendship, list the people in the friendship and the number of tokens they each keep.
